item.title: Chord: A Scalable Peer-to-peer Lookup Service for Internet Applications (2001)
item.description: Chord is a distributed lookup protocol that supports just one operation: mapping a given key onto a node in a Chord cluster. If an \(N\)-node system is in the steady state, each node resolves all the queries via \(O(\log N)\) messages to other nodes. Chord uses consistent hashing to assign keys to Chord nodes.

item.title: Pastry: Scalable Decentralized Object Location and Routing for Large Scale Peer to Peer Systems (2001)
item.description: Pastry is a decentralized peer-to-peer object location and routing system based on nodes connected via the Internet. When each node in the Pastry network receives a message and a numeric key, it routes them to the node with a nodeId that is numerically close to the key. If a node is not the final destination of a message, it forwards the message to another node with a nodeId that is numerically closer to the key than the nodeId of the present node. The nodeId ranges from 0 to \(2^{128}-1\).
